newsitem.title: UK: ACPC sets limit for one year at 52.75 million bags.
newsitem.headline: ACPC sets limit for one year at 52.75 million bags.

text.p: The ACPC said in a statement that the limit on its exports under its extended quota system would be set at 52.75 million bags for the whole of the 12 months starting on July 1.
"The priority of the established policy is to ensure prices remain at a level remunerative to producers, but allowing continuing growth in worldwide consumption of coffee," the ACPC said.
The ACPC said the seasonal allocations of the programme for the whole year would be decided at a later stage, to allow a more flexible and adequate flow of coffee to the market.

It said the technical group of six members would monitor the situation and, if any additional action was needed, it would be suggested to a full council session in September when allocations by semester would be defined, if necessary.
ACPC secretary general Robeiro Oliveira Silva said he was confident that, at present prices, if there was any impact on consumption it would be very small. - - London Newsroom +44 1717 542 7729
